messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text: Nit: No need for a member class for this, just declare/define the class in the .cc file.

messages.author: Mark P
messages.text:
On 2013/02/22 19:53:24, Peter Kasting wrote:
> Nit: No need for a member class for this, just declare/define the class in the
> .cc file.

Done.

I'm not sure where to put the definition and implementation in the .cc.  Please tell me if have a better suggestion for it.

messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text:
This isn't currently called.

Does it need to be a separate function?  Can it be inlined in this class' destructor or something?

messages.author: Mark P
messages.text:
On 2013/02/22 19:53:24, Peter Kasting wrote:
> This isn't currently called.

Good point.  I intended to call it in the in-memory index's Shtudown().  Added call.

> Does it need to be a separate function?  Can it be inlined in this class'
> destructor or something?

I think the destructor is an okay time, but for safety and consistency I'd rather do it before we write the private data to the cache file.  I guess I can put the call in that function and in the destructor if you prefer those two calls to the one call I just added.
